content.description: The most difficult part is moving around the arete.
content.location: This starts at the right arete and follows the obvious crack to top out.

content.description: Climb right to left across the steep back side of The Roofs.  Start on the right hand side of a big edge cutting diagonally across the back side.  This tops out just to the left of Parting the Red Sea.
content.location: It is on the back side of The Roofs.

content.description: The right arete is fun, also a traverse around the right to a dyno of a big edge is great.  There exists potential for a harder line on the overhanging side.
content.location: This is described in Boston Rocks. Going down the main trail, you go past a left fork. Go straight. It's the next right hand fork. The Roofs is up behind that quarry.

content.description: The crux moves are second and third moves.
content.location: This is the rightmost arete. Start with both hands in the crack, and move straight up to top out a finish shared with The Roof.

content.description: This ascends the center of the overhanging back side of the roofs.  It has a low start on a left pinch and a right edge.  There is a small right foothold, shoot out to rail, and then go straight up.
content.protection: Pads.  The landing isn't super great.

content.description: Start on crimps in crack on face. Move up to some edges. Make a big move up right to a nice jug on the lip.
content.location: Start in the crack around the corner and to the right from Rite Arete. See the photo.

content.description: Start low on the arete on two shallow dishes.  Cruise to the heinously hard topout.
content.location: If you are facing the roofs, turn around.  You will see a slab across the way.  Nightcrawler take the arete on the back side of the slab.

content.description: It is good to feel the topout for the other routes. Start way far right of One Trick Pony and Hell and Consequences. Start at a vertical, finger-sized crack. Move left along the lip on some slopers and good holds, and top out same for Hell and Consequences.
content.location: Start on the far right side of the slab around the corner from the overhang.

content.description: Starts on the furthest right arete on the roofs.   follows a distinct line of small sharp vertical crimpers
Start with both of your hands in a horizontal seam, and go straight up with a long reach or two.
content.location: It is between Hell And ConsequencesÂ and One Trick Pony.

content.description: I am not sure where the crux is. It is pretty easy throughout.
content.location: Climb just left of right arete.

content.description: If you like steep, this is where to go.  The side facing away from the quarry has some steep lines with generally not good landings, but use a few pads a spotter and you're fine.
